> download game
> free achievements
> winton jump winton zap
> lucio died
> back to sleep i go

I have mixed feelings on the game.
I've played this game for a long time now.

[b]Pros to me[/b]
- The game can be fun occasionally
- The game is updated frequently (every 2-3 weeks)
- The characters are awesome and futurist
- Not too realistic
- Achievements, Challenges, Hero Progression


[b]Cons to me[/b]
- Owned by a scummy greedy corporation
- Usually promises are broken by Blizzard (No PvE skill tree promised in 2019)
- Skins & cosmetics are pricey ($20 for Skins & Bundles)
- Blizzard makes unnecessary balancing choices to keep players coming back
- Blizzard has made bad mistakes in the past
I will never support Blizzard after they shat on the Overwatch brand as a whole post 2020. Overwatch 2 is a joke and the biggest scam I have ever seen in the gaming community.

å¸é©¬æ¸¸æˆ   è¿›å»ç™»å½• çœ‹å›¾é€‰å‡ºä¸ç«™ç«‹çš„å½¢çŠ¶ç›¸åŒ¹é…çš„åŠ¨ç‰©  æˆ‘çœ‹ä½ å—çš„è‡­é€¼ æˆ‘æ“ä½ å¦ˆ ä½ æ¡£AIè¿˜æ˜¯æŒ¡ç©å®¶å‘¢ï¼Ÿ ä½ æ­»å¦ˆäº†   è·Ÿä½ æ­»å»çš„é©¬çœ‹åŠ¨ç‰©å»å§

I've played 900 hours of this game. The core game is really great - I definitely recommend playing it. The recent "sequel" is nothing but a cash grabbing reskin of the core game. It is more like a patch than anything else. Things that were once free now cost money, they've introduced an expensive battle pass and skin store which no one asked for, all while drip feeding us less than the bare minimum of content required to keep a game alive.

There is still no other game like Overwatch but as soon as there is, this game is dead. 

Download the free version of this game and you will enjoy the core game (for a while at least) but do not spend any money on it.
